[Magick Festival, Second Peddler's Area.]

High above in the fiery sky - not quite night, not quite day - hang tiny flickering lights in the runic shape of protection. An occasional rune plummets to the clouds that serve as the magickally structured walkway, illuminating the touched area and sending arcs of electricity between one ionic light to another. The clouds continually shift beneath you; the shapes always in a state of flux.  Some fluffy white clouds, some flaming flickering protection runes, a smoke and fire MAGICK ITEMS sign, an open chest, a carved maple HAIR STYLES list, a sparkling HAIR PRICES sign, an inky TEXTURES list, a rosewood LENGTH list, a cheerful red EYE PRICES list, and a cheerful red EYE SHAPES are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st brown speckled white gyrfalcon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Kinyo the Noble Frontacian, Xandrix the Noble Secian, Darcissa the Novice Secian, Kavita the Noble Secian, Aravinda the Frontacian, Dulcina the Noble Secian, Tylia the Noble Anthian, Calistar the Draco (seated), Faet the Secian, Marial the Noble Secian, Russa the Noble Human, Silvermane the Human, Alera the Noble Psycian, and Fatima the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground and holding a flaming vanilla scented silver oil lamp).
Obvious paths: south* west*.

[Magick Festival, Second Peddler's Area.]

High above in the fiery sky - not quite night, not quite day - hang tiny flickering lights in the runic shape of protection. An occasional rune plummets to the clouds that serve as the magickally structured walkway, illuminating the touched area and sending arcs of electricity between one ionic light to another. The clouds continually shift beneath you; the shapes always in a state of flux.  Some fluffy white clouds, some flaming flickering protection runes, a smoke and fire MAGICK ITEMS sign, an open chest, a carved maple HAIR STYLES list, a sparkling HAIR PRICES sign, an inky TEXTURES list, a rosewood LENGTH list, a cheerful red EYE PRICES list, and a cheerful red EYE SHAPES are here.

Cuinn looks like a 5'5" standard mature average boned, stocky bodied Human.
He has short, straight, fine platinum blonde hair, with sapphire blue eyes, and looks casual.
He appears to be annoyed right now.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his forehead is the Mark of Moloch.

On his chest is a tall human shaman dressed in pale green robes ripping out a fallen Taathian priest's soul.

On his left calf is a glowing pale green skull with moonsilver eyes.

He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

His gaze greets you with a knowing smirk. A faint green shard of color flickers from within the depths of his dark sapphire eyes as a mysterious countenance befalls his features, masking his intentions.

[Festival of Magick, Entrance.]

An ornate wrought iron fence, detailed with the various runes for each class, surrounds a raised platform in the center of the area; the runes glow and pulsate. The clouds beneath your feet give gently with each footstep, leaving ethereal impressions momentarily before fluffing back up. Above, the sky is alive with streaks of lightening that dance back and forth between more clouds and illuminate the orange-red sky with flashes of brilliant white. Misty letters swirl before you, shifting and melding together into sentences.  Some fluffy white clouds, some glowing dancing lightning streaks, some misty swirling words in the sky, a hovering oak door partially open, an open runesilver handled glass trapdoor, and some floating glass steps are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* southwest* west*.

High above in the fiery sky - not quite night, not quite day - hang tiny flickering lights in the runic shape of protection. An occasional rune plummets to the clouds that serve as the magickally structured walkway, illuminating the touched area and sending arcs of electricity between one ionic light to another. >[Magick Festival, Second Peddler's Area.]

High above in the fiery sky - not quite night, not quite day - hang tiny flickering lights in the runic shape of protection. An occasional rune plummets to the clouds that serve as the magickally structured walkway, illuminating the touched area and sending arcs of electricity between one ionic light to another. The clouds continually shift beneath you; the shapes always in a state of flux.  Some fluffy white clouds, some flaming flickering protection runes, a smoke and fire MAGICK ITEMS sign, an open chest, a carved maple HAIR STYLES list, a sparkling HAIR PRICES sign, an inky TEXTURES list, a rosewood LENGTH list, a cheerful red EYE PRICES list, and a cheerful red EYE SHAPES are here.

This area is illuminated.

An occasional rune plummets to the clouds that serve as the magickally structured walkway, illuminating the touched area and sending arcs of electricity between one ionic light to another. The clouds continually shift beneath you; the shapes always in a state of flux.  Some fluffy white clouds, some flaming flickering protection runes, a smoke and fire MAGICK ITEMS sign, an open chest, a carved maple HAIR STYLES list, a sparkling HAIR PRICES sign, an inky TEXTURES list, a rosewood LENGTH list, a cheerful red EYE PRICES list, and a cheerful red EYE SHAPES are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st brown speckled white gyrfalcon (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Kinyo the Noble Frontacian, Darcissa the Novice Secian, Kavita the Noble Secian, Cuinn the Noble Human, Faet the Secian, Phannah the Noble Human, Mirabelle the Noble Secian, Russa the Noble Human, Silvermane the Human, Ledara the Psycian, Malthus the Psycian (holding a glowing swirling iridescent glass cube), Alera the Noble Psycian, Haberthan the Noble Hithual, and Stormy the Leuian.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

[Festival of Magick, Entrance.]

An ornate wrought iron fence, detailed with the various runes for each class, surrounds a raised platform in the center of the area; the runes glow and pulsate. The clouds beneath your feet give gently with each footstep, leaving ethereal impressions momentarily before fluffing back up. Above, the sky is alive with streaks of lightening that dance back and forth between more clouds and illuminate the orange-red sky with flashes of brilliant white. Misty letters swirl before you, shifting and melding together into sentences.  Some fluffy white clouds, some glowing dancing lightning streaks, some misty swirling words in the sky, a hovering oak door partially open, an open runesilver handled glass trapdoor, and some floating glass steps are here.

[Festival of Magick, Levitating Disc.]

The platform on which you stand is made out of a thick glass, lending a distorted view of clouds and stars lazily passing beneath it. A powerful, softly humming force provides an unseen wall for safety of its passengers as the platform floats mysteriously upon the air. Within the bubble of energy, be it day or night, the air glows a combination of fiery reds and oranges against a darkened blue. Stars faintly glow and twinkle in the dusty light of both the sun and the moon. [South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent, a closed iron gate, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. >[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, a short wooden stick, and a closed small hardened leather sheath are here.

[Bank]

The quiet hum of business that fills your ears as you enter the Market Circle branch of the Rasnian Bank seems oddly out of place as you look around at the damage to the walls and desks. Tellers, many of whom have more than one recent scar in evidence, wait at a long wooden desk at the far end of the room to help you with your banking needs.   An open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a bright wooden sign, and a shimmering gold coin are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st governor's dread knight.
Obvious exits: None.
You fly down and land.

>[Side Street.]

A large building sits on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Rurik's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.   A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

>[Trade Way.]

The well-worn road is crowded with groups of adventuring souls on their way to barter, unlock, and bank their wages. A constant stream travels to the south, into a small but well-tended courtyard. The rest rush past, hoping to thwart those that cling to the shadows and ply their darker trades with nimble fingers.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st slightly glowing city guardsman.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
[Trade Way, Intersection.]

The monotonous line of dull grey buildings separate, revealing a massive domed building. The front walls of the building are dominated by glass panels displaying the latest fashions from several of the stores inside.  A pair of women carrying several shopping bags spin through the glass revolving doors while two grumpy looking men drag behind them with even larger bags. A large banner over the revolving doors proudly displays the name, "The Galleria", for all to see.   A street lantern and an open gold trimmed revolving glass door are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A freshly painted oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east*.
e
e
e
>[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st very loud drunk drag-al.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west*.
e
e
e
>[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east* west*.
[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard mage and the 2nd city guard mage.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, a short wooden stick, and a closed small hardened leather sheath are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Azhure the San Elf, Gwuar the Novice Thugian, Sellenine the Novice Flerian, Quint the San Elf, Suupidosutaa the Monitanian, and Skar the Monitanian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
[Northern Avenue.]

Beds of wildflowers line the carefully placed cobblestones along this street. A pair of love birds, cooing in delight, sit upon a white marble bench. The giggles and laughs of a pair of trysting lovers echoes from the room in the Traveler's Hostel to the east. It is certain that Rinanni looks down upon this scene with delight.  A white marble bench and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

A peaceful bliss pervades the very core of this guilded path. Below a large oak tree a couple of Rinannian priestesses sing lightly in Secti. Several merchants pause to listen to the song. Even a few hardened warriors cannot help but smile at the sweet melody.  A large oak tree, an open dragon-etched emerald door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

[Northern Avenue.]

The distant glimmer from a temple made of white marble and pearl catches your eye. An intricate gilded iron gate and a small winding path are all that separate you from the dazzling temple of Rinanni. Majestic marble statues of doves in flight stand on either side of the gate. The gaze of their peaceful eyes seems to follow your every movement.  An open intricately gilded iron gate, a pair of pure white marble dove statues, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
>[Northern Avenue.]

A large stone building rises just to the east of Northern Avenue. These barracks house those known as Dread Knights. It is not unusual to see patrols of this elite group heading down the street towards Town Square. One would hope their presence would allow everyone to live in peace. If only they would stop fingering their swords all the time, you might believe it yourself.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st loitering bum.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

Northern Avenue ends at a gateway set within the massive city walls. On the other side of the gate are the Guild Halls. Those who pass through accept the bond of peace that the Guilds impose on all who desire their services. On either side of the gate guards stand at attention saluting all those who pass by.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Northern Avenue.]

The city walls tower high above you at the entrance to the guild district. On top of the wall, a very bored looking guard with a lazy eye watches those passing through the gate. The large guild buildings spread out around the district, bustling with the day-to-day activity of the city's guild groups.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

>[Northern Avenue.]

The massive building of the Merchant's Guild looms over a vast part of the guild district. The activity at the main door of the guild is mind numbing as hundreds of citizens and merchants alike rush in and out of the guild to handle their business. While the governor has control over the city guard, many claim it is the Merchant's Guild that runs the city of Spur.  An open exquisite polished mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
[Northern Avenue.]

To the south the road runs back into the center of the city, further to the north the city road continues on toward the other guilds. All the legal city guilds are represented within this city district except for the Forester's Guild. A sign stands beside the road to help direct lost would-be foresters to their guild hall.  A beautiful etched wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue]

Numerous citizens walk purposefully along the busy street. Fighters and mercenaries make up the majority, but some from almost all walks of life hurry past as well. A dejected street cleaner struggles to keep up with the messes left behind by the pets and other beasts that travel on the roads.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
n
n
>[Crossing.]

Northern Avenue meets Art Avenue at this intersection. Further to the north, the Mercenary's Guild makes its home, while the Bard's and Sage's Guilds are to the east. The extravagant Merchant's Guild stands to the south. Various sponsors wave pieces of parchment in an attempt to recruit new members.  An open lustrous hammered steel door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

The sounds of clashing steel and the calls of battle fill the air near the entrance to the Mercenary's Guild. Numerous hardened warriors lean up against the walls of the building waiting for job offers, while others move in and out of the guild hall going about their daily business. By the looks of it, some of the veterans are giving a barbarian near the front door a hard time.  An open white cedar door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

A narrow steel gate leads through a short white stone wall. Beyond the gate lies the practice yard for the Mercenary's Guild. Novice mercenaries sit or stand outside the gate, either resting from their exertions or gathering their courage to enter. Piles of old bandages lie beside the road. Behind the practice yard, the incredible outer wall stands high above the city.  An open polished oak door, a street lantern, and an open shattered grey steel gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.
go gate
>[Burned Mercenary Guild Yard]

A stained white brick wall stands along the south end of the practice yard. The hard-packed sand ground is soaked in blood and the remains of armor. Broken lanterns litter the ground.  An open shattered grey steel gate is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* west* northwest*.

[Mercenary's Guild Practice Yard.]

A white brick wall stands along the south end of the practice yard. Dark stains cover much of the hard-packed sand ground. Lanterns hang from widely spaced posts, providing good lighting at night.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* west* northwest*.

>
Romilin looks like a 5'5" standard adolescent average boned, average bodied Psycian.
He is seated.
He has long, straight, wispy glossy black hair, with crystal blue eyes, and looks casual.
He appears to be dumbfounded right now.
He can be attacked by other players.
He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

Physical appearance:

Fierce yet kind at the same time.

                        Visible Equipment
A silver rose crested black morbius shield         (shield)
A star of Psycia inlaid moonsilver circlet         (on head)
A bright star-shaped morbius magician's amulet     (around neck)
A pair of polished moonsilver bracers              (over hands)
A pair of satin lined leather boots                (on feet)
A pitch black spidersilk cloak                     (over armor)
A radiant blue crystalla star of Psycia band       (ring (right))
A small diamond and sapphire ring                  (ring (right))
Some midnight blue spidersilk pants                (pants)
A knitted fleece sweater                           (shirt)

A spell.  (Fading)

  Noble of the Realm

Additional titles earned:
  Lord of the Realm of Spur

[Burned Mercenary Guild Yard]

A white brick wall stands along the south end of the practice yard. The hard-packed sand ground is soaked in blood and the remains of armor. Broken lanterns litter the ground.  A short iron dirk, a short iron dirk, a closed muddy bearskin pouch, and a closed dirty cloth pouch are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st large rat.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* west* northwest*.

This room is illuminated.

>You find something suitably reflective and gaze into it...

You look like a 1'2" standard adolescent delicate boned, wiry-tough bodied Secian Cleric.
You are seated.
You have very long, wild, kinky white hair with a white streak, heavy lidded pale red eyes, and look translucent.
You appear to be apprehensive right now.
You can be attacked by other players.

On her breast is a small crescent shaped birthmark.

On her neck is a purple marked tattoo of the house of Mandor.

On her belly is a tark tribal circle around the navel.

On her back are glimmering deep Hyacinth wings with draconic runes in Golde upon them.

On her head, behind her left ear is a deep blue Something.

On her left arm is a tattooed sleeve of intertwined purple dragons stretching from her shoulder to her wrist.

You appear to be in perfect health.
There is a shining gold emblem affixed to your clothing.

Physical appearance:

You see an ageless, tymless, spryte with long wild kinky whyte hair with a glowing whyte streak and sleepy eyes...She is shivering in the cold wind to Valhalla...She has touched the Sky...

go gate
>[Northern Avenue.]

A narrow steel gate leads through a short white stone wall. Beyond the gate lies the practice yard for the Mercenary's Guild. Novice mercenaries sit or stand outside the gate, either resting from their exertions or gathering their courage to enter. Piles of old bandages lie beside the road. Behind the practice yard, the incredible outer wall stands high above the city.  An open polished oak door, a street lantern, and an open shattered grey steel gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south*.

s
s
s
>[Northern Avenue.]

The sounds of clashing steel and the calls of battle fill the air near the entrance to the Mercenary's Guild. Numerous hardened warriors lean up against the walls of the building waiting for job offers, while others move in and out of the guild hall going about their daily business. By the looks of it, some of the veterans are giving a barbarian near the front door a hard time.  An open white cedar door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st street urchin and the 1st slightly glowing city guardsman.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
s
s
[Crossing.]

Northern Avenue meets Art Avenue at this intersection. Further to the north, the Mercenary's Guild makes its home, while the Bard's and Sage's Guilds are to the east. The extravagant Merchant's Guild stands to the south. Various sponsors wave pieces of parchment in an attempt to recruit new members.  An open lustrous hammered steel door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard mage and the 2nd city guard mage.
Obvious paths: north* east* south*.
[Northern Avenue]

Numerous citizens walk purposefully along the busy street. Fighters and mercenaries make up the majority, but some from almost all walks of life hurry past as well. A dejected street cleaner struggles to keep up with the messes left behind by the pets and other beasts that travel on the roads.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st busy townsman.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

To the south the road runs back into the center of the city, further to the north the city road continues on toward the other guilds. All the legal city guilds are represented within this city district except for the Forester's Guild. A sign stands beside the road to help direct lost would-be foresters to their guild hall.  A beautiful etched wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st puppy.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

The massive building of the Merchant's Guild looms over a vast part of the guild district. The activity at the main door of the guild is mind numbing as hundreds of citizens and merchants alike rush in and out of the guild to handle their business. While the governor has control over the city guard, many claim it is the Merchant's Guild that runs the city of Spur.  An open exquisite polished mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

The city walls tower high above you at the entrance to the guild district. On top of the wall, a very bored looking guard with a lazy eye watches those passing through the gate. The large guild buildings spread out around the district, bustling with the day-to-day activity of the city's guild groups.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st beggar.
Obvious paths: north*.
go gate
>[Northern Avenue.]

Northern Avenue ends at a gateway set within the massive city walls. On the other side of the gate are the Guild Halls. Those who pass through accept the bond of peace that the Guilds impose on all who desire their services. On either side of the gate guards stand at attention saluting all those who pass by.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st dog.
Obvious paths: south*.

s
>[Northern Avenue.]

A large stone building rises just to the east of Northern Avenue. These barracks house those known as Dread Knights. It is not unusual to see patrols of this elite group heading down the street towards Town Square. One would hope their presence would allow everyone to live in peace. If only they would stop fingering their swords all the time, you might believe it yourself.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

The distant glimmer from a temple made of white marble and pearl catches your eye. An intricate gilded iron gate and a small winding path are all that separate you from the dazzling temple of Rinanni. Majestic marble statues of doves in flight stand on either side of the gate. The gaze of their peaceful eyes seems to follow your every movement.  An open intricately gilded iron gate, a pair of pure white marble dove statues, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st loitering bum and the 2nd loitering bum.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

s
[Northern Avenue.]

A peaceful bliss pervades the very core of this guilded path. Below a large oak tree a couple of Rinannian priestesses sing lightly in Secti. Several merchants pause to listen to the song. Even a few hardened warriors cannot help but smile at the sweet melody.  A large oak tree, an open dragon-etched emerald door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

Beds of wildflowers line the carefully placed cobblestones along this street. A pair of love birds, cooing in delight, sit upon a white marble bench. The giggles and laughs of a pair of trysting lovers echoes from the room in the Traveler's Hostel to the east. It is certain that Rinanni looks down upon this scene with delight.  A white marble bench and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
se
[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, an open small hardened leather sheath, a short wooden stick, and a short wooden stick are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Kraggon the Noble Hithual, Azhure the San Elf, Sliktibbits the Noble Go-blin-al, Kelthazod the San Elf, Bethany the Noble Psycian, and Skar the Monitanian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
land softly
[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, an open emerald steel door, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Gwuar the Novice Thugian.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.

>[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Gwuar the Novice Thugian.

>[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  An open tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
sw
[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
go gate
[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast*.
[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* west*.
s
s
>[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a floating blue ruby staircase leading down, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
s
s
[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. The occasional high pitched cackle sounds out from the shack, garnering strange looks from all who pass by. A mysterious gothic structure rises up on the opposite side of the street, the occasional explosion thundering out from within its doors, followed by muffled curses and breaking glass.  An open thick iron door, a closed ugly rotting door, a rotting oak sign, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black cat.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

go door
[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
shop renew energy
>You step forward and speak with the proprietor...

The rune mage accepts your 10sp and presses a glowing tube against the rune.  There is a slight stinging sensation and then the tube is removed.

The energy rune has been renewed as requested.

go door
>[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st battle-scarred hithual soldier.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

n
n
>[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. The occasional high pitched cackle sounds out from the shack, garnering strange looks from all who pass by. A mysterious gothic structure rises up on the opposite side of the street, the occasional explosion thundering out from within its doors, followed by muffled curses and breaking glass.  An open thick iron door, a closed ugly rotting door, a rotting oak sign, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black cat.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
n
[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a floating blue ruby staircase leading down, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* west*.
go gate
>[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast*.

ne
>[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

ne
ne
>[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st panhandler.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  An open tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.
n
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, an open small hardened leather sheath, a short wooden stick, and a short wooden stick are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Kraggon the Noble Hithual, Azhure the San Elf, Sliktibbits the Noble Go-blin-al, Kelthazod the San Elf, Tinuz the Noble Go-blin-al, Paine the San Elf, Bethany the Noble Psycian, and Skar the Monitanian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
n
n
>[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
[Northern Avenue.]

Beds of wildflowers line the carefully placed cobblestones along this street. A pair of love birds, cooing in delight, sit upon a white marble bench. The giggles and laughs of a pair of trysting lovers echoes from the room in the Traveler's Hostel to the east. It is certain that Rinanni looks down upon this scene with delight.  A white marble bench and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

A peaceful bliss pervades the very core of this guilded path. Below a large oak tree a couple of Rinannian priestesses sing lightly in Secti. Several merchants pause to listen to the song. Even a few hardened warriors cannot help but smile at the sweet melody.  A large oak tree, an open dragon-etched emerald door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

n
>[Northern Avenue.]

The distant glimmer from a temple made of white marble and pearl catches your eye. An intricate gilded iron gate and a small winding path are all that separate you from the dazzling temple of Rinanni. Majestic marble statues of doves in flight stand on either side of the gate. The gaze of their peaceful eyes seems to follow your every movement.  An open intricately gilded iron gate, a pair of pure white marble dove statues, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

A large stone building rises just to the east of Northern Avenue. These barracks house those known as Dread Knights. It is not unusual to see patrols of this elite group heading down the street towards Town Square. One would hope their presence would allow everyone to live in peace. If only they would stop fingering their swords all the time, you might believe it yourself.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

Northern Avenue ends at a gateway set within the massive city walls. On the other side of the gate are the Guild Halls. Those who pass through accept the bond of peace that the Guilds impose on all who desire their services. On either side of the gate guards stand at attention saluting all those who pass by.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

n
>[Northern Avenue.]

The massive building of the Merchant's Guild looms over a vast part of the guild district. The activity at the main door of the guild is mind numbing as hundreds of citizens and merchants alike rush in and out of the guild to handle their business. While the governor has control over the city guard, many claim it is the Merchant's Guild that runs the city of Spur.  An open exquisite polished mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

To the south the road runs back into the center of the city, further to the north the city road continues on toward the other guilds. All the legal city guilds are represented within this city district except for the Forester's Guild. A sign stands beside the road to help direct lost would-be foresters to their guild hall.  A beautiful etched wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

[Northern Avenue]

Numerous citizens walk purposefully along the busy street. Fighters and mercenaries make up the majority, but some from almost all walks of life hurry past as well. A dejected street cleaner struggles to keep up with the messes left behind by the pets and other beasts that travel on the roads.  A street lantern is here.

[Crossing.]

Northern Avenue meets Art Avenue at this intersection. Further to the north, the Mercenary's Guild makes its home, while the Bard's and Sage's Guilds are to the east. The extravagant Merchant's Guild stands to the south. Various sponsors wave pieces of parchment in an attempt to recruit new members. [Northern Avenue.]

The sounds of clashing steel and the calls of battle fill the air near the entrance to the Mercenary's Guild. Numerous hardened warriors lean up against the walls of the building waiting for job offers, while others move in and out of the guild hall going about their daily business. [Northern Avenue.]

A narrow steel gate leads through a short white stone wall. Beyond the gate lies the practice yard for the Mercenary's Guild. Novice mercenaries sit or stand outside the gate, either resting from their exertions or gathering their courage to enter. Piles of old bandages lie beside the road. Behind the practice yard, the incredible outer wall stands high above the city.  An open polished oak door, a street lantern, and an open shattered grey steel gate are here.

[Burned Mercenary Guild Yard]

The massive stone city wall stands to the north, stretching high above. The hard-packed sand ground is soaked in blood and the remains of armor. Broken lanterns litter the ground.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st large rodent.
In the room is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious exits: east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.

l at bi

Binx looks like a 1'7" standard adolescent delicate boned, wiry-tough bodied Secian.
He has shoulder length, tied back, sandy blonde hair, with ruby red eyes, and looks casual.
He appears to be happy right now.
He bears the mark of Sa.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his body arcane runes shimmer in every color of the rainbow.

On his wings are delicate, intricate ruby swirls that shimmer with the slightest movement.

On his skin are various patches of light green.

He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

Physical appearance:

He has translucent deep violet wings with intricate ruby swirls.

                        Visible Equipment
Some damaged heavy ruby encrusted morbius armor    (armor)
A crackling rune-etched opal hilted staff          (shield)
A fiery red ruby jewel                             (around neck)
Some black velvet boots                            (on feet)
A pale blue cloak of mist                          (over armor)
A glowing enchanted opal ring                      (ring (right))
An entwined ruby and emerald bondmate's ring       (ring (left))
A tiny dragon-etched moonsilver ear cuff           (left ear)
A pair of tailored black wool trousers             (pants)
A knitted midnight blue wool sweater               (shirt)
A royal purple runesilk sash                       (on belt)


A wall of force.  (Powerful)

>[Burned Mercenary Guild Yard]

The massive stone city wall stands to the north, stretching high above. The hard-packed sand ground is soaked in blood and the remains of armor. Broken lanterns litter the ground.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st large rodent and the 1st giant rat.
In the room is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious exits: east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.

[Burned Mercenary Guild Yard]

A stained white brick wall stands along the south end of the practice yard. The hard-packed sand ground is soaked in blood and the remains of armor. Broken lanterns litter the ground.  An open shattered grey steel gate is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* east* west* northwest*.

You follow Romilin through an open shattered grey steel gate...

[Northern Avenue.]

A narrow steel gate leads through a short white stone wall. Beyond the gate lies the practice yard for the Mercenary's Guild. Novice mercenaries sit or stand outside the gate, either resting from their exertions or gathering their courage to enter. Piles of old bandages lie beside the road. Behind the practice yard, the incredible outer wall stands high above the city.  An open polished oak door, a street lantern, and an open shattered grey steel gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: south*.

You follow Romilin south...

[Northern Avenue.]

The sounds of clashing steel and the calls of battle fill the air near the entrance to the Mercenary's Guild. Numerous hardened warriors lean up against the walls of the building waiting for job offers, while others move in and out of the guild hall going about their daily business. By the looks of it, some of the veterans are giving a barbarian near the front door a hard time.  An open white cedar door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st violet robed priest.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Romilin south...

[Crossing.]

Northern Avenue meets Art Avenue at this intersection. Further to the north, the Mercenary's Guild makes its home, while the Bard's and Sage's Guilds are to the east. The extravagant Merchant's Guild stands to the south. Various sponsors wave pieces of parchment in an attempt to recruit new members.  An open lustrous hammered steel door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st mounted city guard.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* east* south*.

You follow Romilin south...

[Northern Avenue]

Numerous citizens walk purposefully along the busy street. Fighters and mercenaries make up the majority, but some from almost all walks of life hurry past as well. A dejected street cleaner struggles to keep up with the messes left behind by the pets and other beasts that travel on the roads.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.

>[Northern Avenue.]

The massive building of the Merchant's Guild looms over a vast part of the guild district. The activity at the main door of the guild is mind numbing as hundreds of citizens and merchants alike rush in and out of the guild to handle their business. While the governor has control over the city guard, many claim it is the Merchant's Guild that runs the city of Spur.  An open exquisite polished mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

The city walls tower high above you at the entrance to the guild district. On top of the wall, a very bored looking guard with a lazy eye watches those passing through the gate. The large guild buildings spread out around the district, bustling with the day-to-day activity of the city's guild groups.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

[Northern Avenue.]

Northern Avenue ends at a gateway set within the massive city walls. On the other side of the gate are the Guild Halls. Those who pass through accept the bond of peace that the Guilds impose on all who desire their services. On either side of the gate guards stand at attention saluting all those who pass by.  An open iron gate, an open thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: south*.

s
>[Northern Avenue.]

A large stone building rises just to the east of Northern Avenue. These barracks house those known as Dread Knights. It is not unusual to see patrols of this elite group heading down the street towards Town Square. One would hope their presence would allow everyone to live in peace. If only they would stop fingering their swords all the time, you might believe it yourself.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

The distant glimmer from a temple made of white marble and pearl catches your eye. An intricate gilded iron gate and a small winding path are all that separate you from the dazzling temple of Rinanni. Majestic marble statues of doves in flight stand on either side of the gate. The gaze of their peaceful eyes seems to follow your every movement.  An open intricately gilded iron gate, a pair of pure white marble dove statues, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Northern Avenue.]

A peaceful bliss pervades the very core of this guilded path. Below a large oak tree a couple of Rinannian priestesses sing lightly in Secti. Several merchants pause to listen to the song. Even a few hardened warriors cannot help but smile at the sweet melody.  A large oak tree, an open dragon-etched emerald door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Northern Avenue.]

Beds of wildflowers line the carefully placed cobblestones along this street. A pair of love birds, cooing in delight, sit upon a white marble bench. The giggles and laughs of a pair of trysting lovers echoes from the room in the Traveler's Hostel to the east. It is certain that Rinanni looks down upon this scene with delight.  A white marble bench and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious exits: north* south*.
[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city guard mage and the 2nd city guard mage.

Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.
[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, an open small hardened leather sheath, a short wooden stick, a short wooden stick, and a broken flaming oil lamp are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Rylek the Noble San Elf, Romilin the Noble Psycian, Anyah the Human, Oarblade the Noble Hithual, Tinuz the Noble Go-blin-al, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Akrataire the Arachnian, Moten the Noble Hithual, Silvermane the Human, Jaicie the Noble Hithual, and Skar the Monitanian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

>[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  An open tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.
[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

>[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.

[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

>[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a floating blue ruby staircase leading down, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
go door
[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. The occasional high pitched cackle sounds out from the shack, garnering strange looks from all who pass by. A mysterious gothic structure rises up on the opposite side of the street, the occasional explosion thundering out from within its doors, followed by muffled curses and breaking glass.  An open thick iron door, a closed ugly rotting door, a rotting oak sign, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Romilin the Noble Psycian.

[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, some flaming ruby ashes, and a spent wooden torch are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious exits: None.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. [Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon, an open small hardened leather sheath, a short wooden stick, a short wooden stick, and a broken flaming oil lamp are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Rylek the Noble San Elf, Romilin the Noble Psycian, Anyah the Human, Oarblade the Noble Hithual, Tinuz the Noble Go-blin-al, Panick the Noble Drag-al, Moten the Noble Hithual, Lanex the Leuian (seated), Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame), Jaicie the Noble Hithual, and Skar the Monitanian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

An upbeat ballad fills the air as the notes played by Anyah are carried far off into the distance.

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, an open Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

[Entry room.]

The only feature in this hot room is the staircase which seems to descend into gloom. You cannot help but shiver as you look at it, and the reason for this is unclear to you. Whatever is down there has been a source of apprehension to many, many people.  Some stairs and an open stone door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Romilin the Noble Psycian and Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious exits: None.

You follow Binx through some stairs...

[Death march.]

The hallway ahead of you is unlike any that you have seen previously. The walls are solid black stone, and the atmosphere is sullen and depressing. You can somehow feel the cries of hundreds of tormented people who have taken this walk.  Some stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Romilin the Noble Psycian and Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious exits: north.

You follow Binx north...

[Death march.]

The hallway is unnaturally quiet and you find yourself whispering your words for no apparent reason. You can hear quiet moaning ahead, and wonder if anyone is still down here. You see a door up the hall to the north.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Romilin the Noble Psycian and Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious exits: north south*.

You follow Binx north...

[Death march.]

The door to the north is very imposing, and seems to represent finality in some way. You can hear soft moaning through it, even though it appears to be very thick. You are still whispering in this hallway, and watching your steps carefully.  An open stone door is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Romilin the Noble Psycian and Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious exits: south*.

You follow Binx through an open stone door...

[Torture chamber.]

Once you enter this enormous area, you realize why you felt the terrible apprehension. Death is all around you in the form of torture devices of all kinds. The area is very dim, even in torchlight, and you have an urge to run screaming from the horror!  An open stone door is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Romilin the Noble Psycian and Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious exits: north northeast east west northwest.

You follow Binx northwest...

[Torture chamber.]

You are in the very middle of the torture chamber, and all around you are the instruments of death and pain. At your feet is a pile of broken wood and leather, but you do not see any trace of metal anywhere in the area.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Romilin the Noble Psycian and Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious exits: north northeast east southeast* south southwest west northwest.

Binx looks like a 1'7" standard adolescent delicate boned, wiry-tough bodied Secian.
He has shoulder length, tied back, sandy blonde hair, with ruby red eyes, and looks casual.
He appears to be happy right now.
He bears the mark of Sa.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his body arcane runes shimmer in every color of the rainbow.

On his wings are delicate, intricate ruby swirls that shimmer with the slightest movement.

On his skin are various patches of light green.

He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

He has translucent deep violet wings with intricate ruby swirls.

In the room are Romilin the Noble Psycian and Binx the Secian.

Romilin's head suddenly begins glowing. He touches the lesser demon briefly. The glow travels down an arm to his hand. The glow quickly spreads over the lesser demon's entire body, then fades away.


The black web before Binx flies out and entraps the lesser demon, causing its skin to fester and rot away!

The black web about the lesser demon breaks apart.

info vis
>                        You have visualized the following locations
                        -------------------------------------------

                                    Visualization #1 is:
A Temple. The Temple. Not surrounded by satellite buildings of faith, but part and parcel of the bustling city life. Archways and buttresses soar toward the heavens, creamy white marble reflecting all light.

                                    Visualization #2 is:
The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.

                                    Visualization #3 is:
The latticework surrounding and covering the spiral staircase is finely crafted. The intertwining beams seem to weave a delicate pattern above you, accenting the view of the forest floor. Soft, new, growth can be seen all over the forest below. A small mound of moss has slowly begun to cover the old inn, creating a fuzzy green mound. A large pile of Elven rope sits near the silent Golem. This creature of Elindale helps defend the city by retrieving the rope that people have pushed down to the forest below.

Your active visualization is #2

[Elindale Animal Sanctuary.]

A vast grassy plain stretches out before you. In the distance you can see a group of oliphants, and another larger group of deer grazing in peace. Several lanky trees grow in front of the outer city wall, giving comfortable shade for creatures to relax in. Under one of the larger trees a lioness watches her cubs rough housing in the tall grass, carefully making sure they don't wander off and get into mischief.  Some sweet green grass, a tiny maidenhair sapling, and a small red and white ring of mushrooms are here.
