[Elindale Animal Sanctuary.]

A verdant field of grass spreads out before you. A large tree sits in the middle, its low slung branches brimming with tasty, ripe, fruit. A small herd of goats graze on the grass, occasionally finding a fruit treat to share. Several wild horses nibble on the higher branches, causing fruit to drop to the ground. As each piece hits the grass, one member of a raccoon family hastily grabs it and runs down to the pond to wash it carefully.  A finely crafted wooden bridge and a large juicy redfruit are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious paths: west northwest*.

You follow Binx through a finely crafted wooden bridge...

[Elindale Animal Sanctuary.]

Pooling water is held back by a nicely crafted dam. Beavers are busy at work, creating an architectural masterpiece, while their cousins, the otters, enjoy a frolic in the deep cold water. Small animals spend their afternoon on the banks of the small stream that trickles out past the beaver dam, drinking their fill of the cool clear water, and cleaning their food for consumption. A finely crafted wooden bridge allows for travel across the water for all of Elindale's creatures.  A finely crafted wooden bridge is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious paths: southwest west.

You follow Binx southwest...

[Elindale Animal Sanctuary.]

A small, carefully tended cottage looks out across the verdant fields and the babbling creek. On the porch a little old lady sits and rocks slowly, carefully watching her charges. In the well fenced yard, pups of all ages and sizes run around chasing not only each other, but quite often their own tails. In the shade of the quiet porch, several cats preen. They carefully clean their fur, and watch over the antics of the dogs in the yard, knowing they are far superior and would never be caught acting so foolish.  A closed light green wooden door is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest west northwest.

You follow Binx southwest...

[Elindale Animal Sanctuary.]

Standing sentinel over the animals is the largest tree that you have ever seen. Its branches stretch far into the sky, allowing creatures of all types to seek sanctuary within them. Chirps and chitters float down from above as a soft breeze rustles its leaves. The tree's magnificent presence spreads peace and tranquility over the entire area.  An open glistening white gate is here.

[Artist Avenue.]

Calls of various animals fill the air as you move past the glistening white gate before you. From inside the fenced off yard, you can see a massive tree towering high up into the sky to the point it almost reaches the top of the city walls above. Below the tree you can see what looks to be like a small cabin beside a clear glistening pond. It is within the gates at the Elindalian animal sanctuary that the citizen's furry (and not so furry) friends can find safe haven. Many a companion wanders back and forth at the gate looking for their master or friend to return and get them.  An open glistening white gate and a street lantern are here.

[Artist Avenue.]

A small brick building rises up before you, everything about it seems to give off a welcoming feeling from within. Occasionally, a person wanders out of the doors carrying a paper in their hands, their noses stuck between the pages so far that each of them nearly runs into you in passing! The sign hanging over the door is carved out of an ancient oak and looks to have been burnt slightly by some sort of fire. The sign reads, "The Dragon Fire Chronicles".  An open elegant antique oak door, a street lantern, and an oak and brick stall are here.

[Artist Avenue.]

Though the feeling of peace that flows through this entire district is not lost, the relative sense of quiet is totally demolished upon walking past the doors of the nearby store. From within you can hear the horrible sounds of would be musicians playing their versions of such Spurian favorites as "Chunky Stone Potina" and "The Lost Soul Song." It's nothing short of a miracle the owner of the store can stand listening to the horrid attempts of untrained musicians all day. Perhaps it's punishment for breaking some sort of noise ordinance...  A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

[Artist Avenue.]

You stand below the massive city walls where they separate the guild district from the art and music district. Many of the city's less serious folk spend time in the area, wandering around enjoying the pleasant atmosphere or catching a performance from one of the traveling shows. Through the gate you can see the guild district bustling with its day-to-day activity, a far cry from these peaceful and quiet streets. As if trying to perfectly define the feeling that resides within the district, a monk has erected a small hut in honor of the martial arts where negative energy is turned back into positive with every motion of the body.  An open shiny steel gate, an open ancient weathered door, and a street lantern are here.

[Northern Avenue.]

A large stone building rises just to the east of Northern Avenue. These barracks house those known as Dread Knights. It is not unusual to see patrols of this elite group heading down the street towards Town Square. One would hope their presence would allow everyone to live in peace. [Northern Avenue.]

A peaceful bliss pervades the very core of this guilded path. Below a large oak tree a couple of Rinannian priestesses sing lightly in Secti. Several merchants pause to listen to the song. Even a few hardened warriors cannot help but smile at the sweet melody.  A large oak tree, an open dragon-etched emerald door, and a street lantern are here.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, and a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon are here.

This area is illuminated.

Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. You look like a 1'2" standard adolescent delicate boned, wiry-tough bodied Secian Cleric.
You have very long, wild, kinky white hair with a white streak, heavy lidded pale red eyes, and look translucent.

You can be attacked by other players.

On her breast is a small crescent shaped birthmark.

On her neck is a purple marked tattoo of the house of Mandor.

On her belly is a tark tribal circle around the navel.

On her back are glimmering deep Hyacinth wings with draconic runes in Golde upon them.

On her head, behind her left ear is a deep blue Something.

On her left arm is a tattooed sleeve of intertwined purple dragons stretching from her shoulder to her wrist.

You've stumbled into some dark passage. Thousands of strange gemstones of some sort adorn the solid black marble walls. The scarce light that they absorb seems to shimmer and shift within them. You feel very unsafe here.  Some black marble stairs are here.

[Dark Hallway]

With a slight twist this narrow passage bends and heads off to the south. All around you tiny gemstones seem to steal the light away darkening the area even more. Is that an opening you see in the darkness ahead of you?

This room is illuminated.

Obvious exits: northeast* south.

You follow Romilin south...

[Dark Hallway]

The corridor here opens up into a vast chamber which stretches off to the south. The darkness all around you seems to shimmer and assault your vision striking you nearly blind. All you can notice is the silence of this whole area is stunning.

This room is illuminated.

Obvious exits: north* southeast south southwest.

You follow Romilin southeast...

The walls of this entry room are dead black, contrasting sharply with the bright yellow door. To the southeast, you hear unworldly howling and hissing, and to the southwest, you hear a silence so deathly that it is even scarier.  An open yellow door is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest.

Romilin's head suddenly begins glowing. He touches the black horned demon briefly. The glow travels down an arm to his hand. The glow quickly spreads over the black horned demon's entire body, then fades away.


Binx skin begins to turn blue as his blood grows cold. Simple motions take strong effort as if his muscles refuse to work. The black horned demon eyes grow brighter with flame as it leaches the warmth from Binx's body.

Binx is briefly silhouetted by a pale blue glow.

Slowly the black horned demon hold over Binx is released and the color returns to Binx's skin.

This room is illuminated.

The black horned demon releases a howl of frustration, its final, long hot breath pouring out in a stream of chaotic sound that warps the air as it crashes to the ground in a heap.

[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed. [Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, an open Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a lantern are here.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, an open emerald steel door, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. [Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.
You nod.
>
You follow Binx west...

[Town Square.]

Commercial buildings flank Town Square to the west and south of this corner. Imposing buildings stand stiffly to your west, while those to the south have a slightly seedy look about them.  The door to the west has a freshly painted sign over it,  "Under New Management."  An open tan weathered pine door, a large doorway, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st city street cleaner.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southwest*.

You follow Binx southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Before you stands a magnificent white marble temple dedicated to Odarous, the god of chivalry. Ten giant steps made of the same gleaming marble lead up to the temple entrance. Two large statues stand at the base of the stairs, also carved of breath-taking marble. One is a warrior bearing a massive sword and a large shield. The other is a cleric with an amulet bearing the mark of Odarous in one hand and a large mace in the other.  Some gleaming white marble stairs, a polished white marble statue, a polished white marble statue, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st violet robed priest and the 2nd violet robed priest.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Binx southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path heads out of the bustling Town Square and moves southwest towards the District of Magick and Rehas Way. Mixed with the robed mages that move southwest are merchants, customers and thieves alike. Moving quickly, especially with a full purse, is your best bet along this path.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Binx southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Several members of the various mage orders of Spur and well-dressed shoppers seeking rarities travel along Knowledge's Path to and from the District of Magick. The district is the place to find the most talented artisans and craftiest merchants in Spur. It is also home to the mages of the non-elemental order.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Binx southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

A heated discussion breaks out briefly between members of opposing orders of magick. The presence of the city guard rapidly brings an end to the exchange before the verbal debate over power and skill turns into a demonstration.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Binx southwest...

[Knowledge Path.]

Knowledge Path terminates here at the gateway to the Magick District. In respect to the demands of the various religious and guild leaders, magick is kept as far from them as possible. A city plagued by rioting mage haters is the last thing Spur needs.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: northeast*.

You follow Binx through an open stone gate...

[Magick Lane & Rehas Way.]

You are just inside the gateway between the Magick District and the Town Square. These gates stand open at all hours of the day or night. An otherwise unremarkable door is glorified by the sign of the city's healer posted beside it.  A wooden door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

You follow Binx south...

[Magick Lane.]

A massive circular stone platform stands to the side of Magick Lane, strangely entrancing runes carved on every inch of its sides. The symbol of the god Sa, a golden Dragon, fills the space along the top. Raw power and magick seem to flow from the platform, making the air around it crackle with energy. A small sign stands next to the platform with a single word written upon it.  A rune covered platform, a floating blue ruby staircase leading down, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Binx south...

[Magick Lane.]

A low slung building resides on the west side of the street. Chanting can be heard from within.  Occasionally a few sparks rise into the sky, or some unwarranted raindrops begin, but they quickly are quelled. A large pair of wooden doors, their surface carved with rune symbols grace the entrance.  A street lantern and some open rune-etched wooden doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Binx south...

[Magick Lane.]

A squat ugly little shack stands somber on the eastern side of this well swept lane. The occasional high pitched cackle sounds out from the shack, garnering strange looks from all who pass by. A mysterious gothic structure rises up on the opposite side of the street, the occasional explosion thundering out from within its doors, followed by muffled curses and breaking glass.  An open thick iron door, a closed ugly rotting door, a rotting oak sign, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Binx south...

[Magick Lane.]

A small sign hangs from above the door of the well-kept store before you, telling you that it is a rune shop. The occasional bright flash of light from inside the store suggests all kinds of strange and rare magicks are being cast inside! Those who walk past you glance at the rune shop warily and hurry to get past it as quickly as possible. A small sign hangs from the doorknob of the store that reads "Flerians not allowed!"  An intricately carved oak door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Binx through an intricately carved oak door...

[Ragarn's Runes.]

Incredible images cover every free corner of this small store, pictures of every possible rune available for purchase hang from the ceiling, on the walls and some even sit on the floor. Drawn onto scrolls, carved into the wood finish of the building or crafted from any number of other materials, each of the different runes has its own strange feeling of excitement to it. The shop owner looks to know what every one of the runes does.  A large glowing sign, a wooden sign, an intricately carved oak door, and some flaming ruby ashes are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Binx the Secian and Romilin the Noble Psycian.
Obvious exits: None.

Welcome to Dragon's Gate, Glinka!

Good night! The heavens are obscured by the weather.
The weather is currently raining and winds are calm.


l
The area brightens.
[Elindale Animal Sanctuary.]

A vast grassy plain stretches out before you. In the distance you can see a group of oliphants, and another larger group of deer grazing in peace. Several lanky trees grow in front of the outer city wall, giving comfortable shade for creatures to relax in. Under one of the larger trees a lioness watches her cubs rough housing in the tall grass, carefully making sure they don't wander off and get into mischief.  Some sweet green grass, a tiny maidenhair sapling, and a small red and white ring of mushrooms are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast southwest.

>[Elindale Animal Sanctuary.]

A vast grassy plain stretches out before you. In the distance you can see a group of oliphants, and another larger group of deer grazing in peace. Several lanky trees grow in front of the outer city wall, giving comfortable shade for creatures to relax in. Under one of the larger trees a lioness watches her cubs rough housing in the tall grass, carefully making sure they don't wander off and get into mischief.  Some sweet green grass, a tiny maidenhair sapling, and a small red and white ring of mushrooms are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast southwest.

[Entry.]

The walls of this entry room are dead black, contrasting sharply with the bright yellow door. To the southeast, you hear unworldly howling and hissing, and to the southwest, you hear a silence so deathly that it is even scarier.  An open yellow door and an open soft burlap bag are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Binx the Secian (holding a flaming tiny crimson dancing flame) and Romilin the Noble Psycian (holding a flaming moonsilver oil lamp).

[Fort Tarath, Pawnshop.]

For a second-hand outpost store, this shop is kept in remarkably good condition.  Shelves, racks, and hooks line the walls, all filled with previously owned items. info vis
                        You have visualized the following locations
                        -------------------------------------------

                                    Visualization #1 is:
A Temple. The Temple. Not surrounded by satellite buildings of faith, but part and parcel of the bustling city life. Archways and buttresses soar toward the heavens, creamy white marble reflecting all light.

                                    Visualization #2 is:
The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.

                                    Visualization #3 is:
The latticework surrounding and covering the spiral staircase is finely crafted. The intertwining beams seem to weave a delicate pattern above you, accenting the view of the forest floor. Soft, new, growth can be seen all over the forest below. A small mound of moss has slowly begun to cover the old inn, creating a fuzzy green mound. A large pile of Elven rope sits near the silent Golem. This creature of Elindale helps defend the city by retrieving the rope that people have pushed down to the forest below.

Your active visualization is #2

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it. [Right Street.]

The road between the center of town and the housing district is well kept and maintained. Ruts are immediately repaired and small bushes and flowers line the way. >[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. nw
>[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, and a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Kalessin the Noble Drake, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Thistlethorn the Flerian, Enaya the Psycian, Eirlys the Novice Secian, Keen the Secian, and Mael the Thugian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, and a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Kalessin the Noble Drake, Cleric the Noble Leuian, Thistlethorn the Flerian, Enaya the Psycian, Eirlys the Novice Secian, Keen the Secian, and Mael the Thugian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. >[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, an open emerald steel door, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
go door
>[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A marble statue of a Human, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a rosewood sign, a crisp gold lettered vellum notice, a flowing white marble fountain, and a shimmering marble statue of a Dragon are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wolf (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, an open emerald steel door, a street lantern, and a new rosewood sign pointing southeast are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wolf (wearing a small gold collar).
Obvious paths: north* southeast* west* northwest*.
[Bank.]

Two large Thugian guards stand sentinel on each side of the doors to the main branch of the Bank of Spur. Elegant furnishings adorn the office. Polished oak and gold filigree emphasize the wealth that abounds in this establishment. Well-dressed tellers stand ready to help you store your money safely or to reduce your coinage to more manageable form.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, a wooden sign, and a bright wooden sign are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Cieran the Human (holding a flaming tiger-etched coral-trimmed crystal storm lantern).

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole.  A street lantern is here.

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack, a street lantern, and a lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south*.
[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern, an open Secian etched moonsilver door, a pair of open silver forged swinging doors, and a sign above the doors are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st small calico kitten.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west.
[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

>[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

>[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent, a closed iron gate, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.

A wooden signpost gives the directions and distances to the two closest cities. The arrow leading west is denoted as Spur, while the one directing east states Caersech. Next to the signpost rests an elderly druid amidst a cushion of moss, leaves, and flower petals. >[East Trade Road.]

A hedge of spiky brambles forms a natural division from the lands and the swampy terrain to the south. Tall, limbless trees dot the horizon there, their bases lost in the misty depths of the gases hovering over the waters. Now and then a strange, growling sound echos up to the north, or an odd, high-pitched call of some unseen crow, probably feasting on a fallen creature hidden in the mists. The path curves away from the sounds, as popular choice has preferred to travel around the edges, rather than through the marshy sludge.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.
[East Trade Road.]

The open plains are becoming scattered with scraggly trees, the wood of which proving inefficient to use for building as the elements of nature have grown the trunks so twisted and hard in order to withstand the onslaughts of time. Circling around the northern base of a small hill, there lies the lapping edge of the swamp to the south. Small slimy creatures lie on the smooth stones near the water, darting into it at the speed of light as you near them with tiny splashes and echoing wakes blending into the small, gentle waves coming into the shore. Swarms of mosquitoes move along the land in unison, lending them the appearance of large, unified bodies hovering around for the next feast.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast southwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

The dried trees encroach even up to the roadside, here, their limbs reaching down to the passage as if to snatch the unwary passer-by. A sudden shift in the wind brings forth the sullied aroma of death and decay from the swamp southern lands. Slurpish noises belie the path of some creature traveling through the muddy scape, their movements hidden behind the smoky mist that reduces visibility to a mere few feet past the swamp's edge.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast northwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

A white mile-marking stone rises up from the muck near the path, the numbers etched into its surface gathering moss and sludge in their inner edges. A small marsh rat perches atop the stone, eyeing you hungrily with glittering red orbs, its whiskers twitching nervously at you.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east northwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

ne
e
e
se
se
Eyes of creatures too quick to be seen monitor your progress along the road. Their footprints can be seen occasionally, leading back and forth across the path, sometimes following along the edges, bringing to mind the vision of something that might be following you, at this very moment, leaving tiny or perhaps not so tiny footprints along the edge of the road as it stalks its prey.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.
>[East Trade Road.]

Ravens dark as pitch spread their feathers to a wing-span of nearly four feet, so large they are, as they quarrel over an abandoned mule carcass on the roadside breaks out. How final death seems, so casually nature simply encompasses the bodies of the fallen, through carrion hunters or moldy decay. Yet through death there be life again, any number of these ravens being sustained through this death, so they may live. Perhaps only to become sustenance for one of the swamp creatures, who, in turn, spends its life continuing the cycle.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east southwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

A small orb of light hovers in the center of the path before you, only to disappear as you near it, reappearing further away into the swamp. Stepping near the orb to investigate closer only causes it to again blink out of existence, forming once more, deeper into the mists. It soon becomes apparent that the mysterious lights are attempting to slyly lead you into the swamp. To or for what purpose, is the question.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east west*.
[East Trade Road.]

The points of light are becoming bolder, flitting closer and closer to you and beckoning you to join them in the swamp. You must actively concentrate to avoid straying from the path and being hopelessly mired in the swamp.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast west*.
[East Trade Road.]

Tiny lights flit here and there and everywhere around you. Their light twinkles dimly in the sun, but in the darkness of the marsh, they practically shine with an appealing glow.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast northwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

se
e
e
ne
e
The swamp around you begins to thin out until it's nothing more than a very muddy marsh. The tiny lights still sparkle from within the swamp and are calling to you, but not as strongly as before. Another white marker is here.  An open iron gate is here.

>[East Trade Road.]

The white paving stones give way to a boardwalk made of wooden planks.  The wood doesn't appear to be of Spurian make, and looks a great deal older, but very sturdy.  A finely crafted wooden boardwalk is here.

Obvious paths: east northwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

The scraggly weeds of the marsh seem to grow so that they do not touch the road, as opposed to the Spurian road where all the vegetation was hacked off near it.  Even though they are old, the planks bear no moss.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east west*.
[East Trade Road.]

Following the lay of the land, the road curves slightly to the northeast to go around a stand of old trees.  The trees look more like forest trees than marsh trees.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.
[East Trade Road.]

A towering stone obelisk stands next to the road, serving boldly as a road marker.  The arrow east to Caersech shows that it is not much farther, while Spur is far away.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east southwest*.

ne
The marsh is becoming less and less apparent, and larger trees are becoming more common. To the east you see a large forest blotting out a great deal of the sky. One tree in particular towers over all the others. 

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast west*.
>[East Trade Road.]

You hear voices chattering around you but you can't see the source.  After a few moments of listening, you look up into a tree next to the path and see three Fir Elves sitting in the tree talking to each other.  They smile down at you and give you a friendly greeting.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast northwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

All around you the earth is trampled flat.  You see a myriad of footprints and hoofprints in every direction.  A broken post on the side of the road may have once had a sign on it, but was snapped off near the ground.  It looks like someone left here in a hurry.  A broken post is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st merchant.
Obvious paths: northeast northwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

The road becomes a bridge to cross a small river that meanders its way out of the forest to your northeast.  Oddly, the wooden planks of the bridge don't seem to be held up by anything.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east southwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

Runoff from the river to the west makes the ground all around soggy.  It appears to be even more wet to the northeast where a small marsh sits at the entrance to a huge forest spanning as far east as the eye can see.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.
[East Trade Road.]

ne

ne
Large trees begin to bunch around the road that has become little more than a path leading through the undergrowth.  The forest begins to fill your vision as you continue.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast southwest*.
>[East Trade Road.]

As you continue into the forest, you begin to forget that there were ever other colors than brown, green, and black.  As suddenly as that thought comes, you see a set of piercing red eyes in the shadows, that soon scurry away.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east southwest*.
[East Trade Road.]

Puddles of murky water dully reflect the giant trees that surround you.  You feel the prickle of eyes watching you, though you don't get a feeling of malice, just curiosity.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st trader.
Obvious paths: east west* northwest.
[Trail.]

To the west, tall grasses and scraggly trees obscure the view of a small town.  Creating a natural barrier to the east are rows of thorny hedges.  A haze of dark green can be seen to the northeast.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.
[Trail.]

The hedgerows grow less dense and the ground becomes soft and springy. The air has taken on a moist and uncomfortably clammy feel. The top of a very tall hill can be seen far to the southeast.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast southwest*.
[Trail.]

ne
n
ne
n
ne
This looks to be the northern edge of the Eastlands marsh. Each step becomes more difficult as the ground becomes a muddy bog. Straying from the trail would be unwise at this point.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast east southwest*.
>[Trail.]

The trail abruptly disappears into a dense wall of foggy mist. The ground here is soggy. Each step sets off a cacophony of buzzing insects, accompanied by the squelching sound of boots being grabbed by slimy muck.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.
[Trail.]

The trail skirts the border of the dismal marsh. Noxious vapors rise from the stagnant waters that lap at the noticeably narrowing route. What had been a dark green haze can now be distinguished as a massive forest.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast south*.
[Trail.]

Murky water has encroached upon the trail, making the way treacherous. A careful survey of the watery surroundings shows a faint path veering sharply to the north, away from the marsh and toward the forest.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.
[Trail.]

Cypress trees stand firmly rooted in the still-damp earth. Still, it appears the swamp has been left behind. The ground here is firmer and the trail clear.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast south*.

>[Caersech Forest.]

Through the branches of stately trees, glimpses of the sky can be seen. The path continues, winding northwest through the eastern edge of the forest.

Obvious paths: southwest* northwest.
[Path.]

Chittering noises come from overhead and tree branches dip and sway. A small brown shape scampers across the path, gone before it can be glimpsed and identified. The path disappears into a copse of saplings.  A thick copse of saplings is here.

You see the 1st squirrel.

[Copse.]

[Copse.]

The undergrowth thins here, and you are able to pick up traces of the path. To the east, where only a thin line of small trees mark the forest boundary, the marsh ends its reign and what appears to be a grassy plain begins.

>[Path.]

The path progresses along, still skirting the eastern boundary of the forest. Other than the occasional noises common to woodlands, there is no evidence of higher forms of life. A squirrel streaks through the underbrush and up the trunk of a tree.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* northwest.
[Path.]

The trees are becoming taller, and their trunks larger, as you make your way along. The smaller birch and beech trees have given way to graceful elms. A low growl comes from amidst the trunks of the trees, but it is impossible to determine the direction.  A flower entwined iron trap is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast southeast*.
[Path.]

Trees surround you on all sides; for a moment the path is lost to sight. Something slithers through the underbrush. Try as you might, you can't identify what it might have been. You feel uneasy, as though something is watching your every move.  An overgrown path is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast southwest* northwest.
[Brambles.]

Struggling through the underbrush, you make your way down the small trail only to be brought up short by an impenetrable wall of brambles. Plump red berries hang from the small branches of the bushes, guarded by long, sharp thorns. On a low hanging branch overhead, a watchful owl stares at you with golden eyes.  A slightly hidden trail, an ethereal looking owl, some fragrant red rose petals, and a large tangleroot thicket are here.

This area is illuminated.

n
>[Riverside.]

The footbridge that once connected this path to its match on the other side of the overflowing rushing river is now nothing more then a few charred pilings. Tiny insects buzz around their remains, finding a comfortable new home. Lashed to the remains of one of the more sturdy pilings is a tall steel pole. Wrapped around the pole, and tied securely is a taut rope. Bobbing ever so lightly due to the strain of the riverboat, the rope holds tight.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, and some tangleroot skin are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Riverside.]

Swollen beyond its banks, the once small creek is now a rushing overflowing river. What used to be the charred footbridge is now a safe haven for fish well down river, nothing left of its structure. Set well into the bank of the river is a long steel pole. Lashed to the pole is a heavy rope. The voice of the riverboat captain can be heard echoing across the water, taking command and moving his cargo.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, a large pool of mud, and a riverboat are here.

[Bubbling forest stream.]

The path here turns due west, climbing the river bank towards taller evergreen trees. The river rumbles loudly, singing its ancient tune. North of the river, fir and cedar begin to dominate while the deciduous varieties fade.  Some fresh flowering sprouts and a small hut are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* west.
w
>[Forest Path.]

The path continues to the west through a mix of moss covered Fir and Alder trees. Further to the west, taller trees designate the incline of a hill. All around the trunks of the taller trees, a large patch of glossy leafed ivy spreads over the burned remains of the old city.  Several charred planks lay in piles under the proliferous ivy as nature's cycle of renewal chews, burrows, disintegrates and mulches the wood back to the soil.  Some mossy Fir trees and some majestic ivy covered Alder trees are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* west.
w
>[Forest Path.]

The path forks around the hill to the northwest and southwest. The hill definitely makes you uneasy, especially when you notice its unnatural regularity. The undergrowth is so thick it prevents you from climbing the hill.  A thick undergrowth is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east* southwest northwest.
sw
>[Forest path.]

Somehow the rumbling river seems to have died out here into a calm steady stream. Much of the water looks to be disappearing into some sort of side cavern that runs beneath the side of the river bank.

sw
>[Bend in forest path.]

The path bends to the northwest and northeast here, skirting the foot of the hill. The stream bubbles along seemingly unaffected by the loathsome presence of the hill. Moss, lichen and ferns cover the ground, making for a soft bed, if you dared to sleep.  A clear mossy river and an ivy entwined wooden gazebo are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* northwest.
nw
>[Branch in forest path.]

The path branches again, finally leading away from the hill. Your feet and legs are getting damp as the wet ferns brush against your legs. The trees open up slightly here and you think it would be a nice place to rest, if it weren't for the hill.  Some lush ferns are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest northwest.
sw
>[Forest path.]

This area is illuminated.

The path bends to the northwest and northeast here, skirting the foot of the hill. The stream bubbles along seemingly unaffected by the loathsome presence of the hill. Moss, lichen and ferns cover the ground, making for a soft bed, if you dared to sleep.  A clear mossy river and an ivy entwined wooden gazebo are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast northwest.
>[Branch in forest path.]

The path branches again, finally leading away from the hill. Your feet and legs are getting damp as the wet ferns brush against your legs. The trees open up slightly here and you think it would be a nice place to rest, if it weren't for the hill.  Some lush ferns are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest northwest.
[Forest path.]

The path slopes down to the south here as it leads away from the hill.  The evergreens subside as the ground becomes moist due to the proximity of the stream. The undergrowth is quite thick here, and the music of the stream begins to pervade your senses.  A charming embankment is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* south.
[Forest stream.]

The path ends here as it comes upon the steep banks of a forest stream.  A wooden bridge, in surprisingly good repair, crosses the stream. The skeletal remains of some fish litter the stream bank and nosing about you notice some large pawprints.  A wooden bridge, some skeletal fish remains, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast.
[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, some flowering jasmine vines, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east.
e
>[Hope's Path.]

Once dead and blackened trees now come to life with spots of moss and growth. A patch of wild mushrooms grows at the base of one of the trees. Small, four-leaf-clover shaped stones, form a small path through the area. The soft sound of running water echoes in from the west.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: east southeast west*.
se
>[Hope's Path.]

A fine haze of dust hovers over the remains of the Silver Owl Inn. Through the fallen timbers and memories of lives lost, one can see brilliant green sprouts reaching for sunlight. A tiny songbird perches on an old stick of furniture poking through the rubble, singing sweetly to herald new life and hope. A small winding path of stones placed in the shape of four leaf clovers winds itself through the forest.  A small winding stone pathway and a charred flowering steelwood tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast south northwest*.
s
>[Hope's Path.]

A small path, its stones in the shape of four leaf clovers, winds its way through the sparse remains of a once dense undergrowth. New plants and flowers begin to rise from the blackened floor, bringing a new color and life to the area.  A small winding stone pathway and a mossy cracked steelwood tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southeast southwest.
se
>[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast east* southwest northwest*.
e
>[Hope's Path.]

Carefully winding its way up the base of the tree, and wrapping itself around the stairs, a flowering jasmine vine grows tall and lush. Dark scars from a past fire are almost hidden under tufts of fresh growth and moss. A large gap, nearly sixteen feet in distance, rests between the base of a set of stairs and the forest floor. A long moonsilver cord hangs down the side of the tree. If one pulls it, the long Elven rope will descend from above, allowing them to enter the great city of Treehaven. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some vine-covered steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, some clover shaped stones, some sweet scented flowering jasmine vines, a long woven moonsilver cord, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north east south west*.

>[Steps.]

The latticework surrounding and covering the spiral staircase is finely crafted. The intertwining beams seem to weave a delicate pattern above you, accenting the view of the forest floor. Soft, new, growth can be seen all over the forest below. A small mound of moss has slowly begun to cover the old inn, creating a fuzzy green mound. A large pile of Elven rope sits near the silent Golem. This creature of Elindale helps defend the city by retrieving the rope that people have pushed down to the forest below.  Some steps circling the tree and a freshly carved wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wooden golem.
Obvious paths: None.
[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, and an open large straw basket are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st wooden golem.
Obvious exits: north*.

>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

The branches of this tree have begun to grow through the wooden platform. The limbs have begun to twist and turn, forming their own natural base. Soft leaves create a cushion and boast several small buds. The empty remains of an abandoned building is just barely visible between the branches, buried in vines and moss. Intricately crafted stairs lead from the platform to the building that resides in the upper branches.  An open door, some finely crafted wooden stairs, a painted wooden sign, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: northeast* west*.

>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Leaves and small twigs spot the walkway as it hugs against the trunk of the Mother Tree. New sprouts from the branches above hang softly over the wooden planks, shading it slightly. A large building rests gently against the trunk in the limbs above, nestled as though it grew from within the tree itself.  An oak ladder is here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.
n
>[Treehaven, Main Platform]

Firm wooden planks fit snuggly to create the walkway that extends proudly upon the reconstructed supports. The view of the forest to the northwest is quite panoramic. A staircase here seems to have some enchantment, judging by the strange appearance of unicorns, bears and owls on the lower steps. Strange, due to the fact that they don't appear carved, painted, or placed by any hand-made means. It is as if the glyphs grew into the wood itself. Mysterious symbols are scattered throughout the portraits, which shimmer with a golden whisper as they are approached.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* south* northwest*.
go st
>[Elindale's Temple.]

This is the main entrance of a Temple of Elindale, the inside walls perfectly smooth with glowing magickal symbols upon the surfaces. The enormity of this tree becomes apparent as one travels up the stairs to the northwest. The air holds a fresh, new ambiance, pleasantly scented with sweet sap and rich, earthly undertones.  Some glowing magickal symbols and a brown oak staircase are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northwest*.
nw
ne
>[Elindale's Temple.]

Encircling the innards of this tree, these steps coil clock-wise to the top, the entire environment one single living thing. There are no cracks, no signs of building. Tapestries on the wall appear life-like, suspended with no visible attachments.  A breathtaking tapestry is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: northeast* southeast*.
se
sw
>[Elindale's Temple.]

A diminutive niche in the wall provides shelter to a small family of flying squirrels. Just inside sit the young, comfortably settled into the soft bedding the parents have gathered up. A breeze carries their tiny chitters to your ears, revealing that the niche is somehow connected to the outside world as well.  A niche in the wall is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast* southwest*.
[Elindale's Temple.]

A large tapestry lines the outside wall of the passageway, most impressive in that it is not made of fabric, but of vines as tiny as thick hairs, growing in a weave. The delicate shadings of the plants is perfectly natural, and as the eye becomes unfocused, a picture of a diminutive, beautiful maiden sits amongst a foresty background. The wall opposite of this magnificent tapestry is lined with portraits of prominent temple leaders, the colors vibrant, bringing a life-like sense to the frames. The eyes of the maiden in the tapestry seem to follow you, staring directly as you pass, boring into your soul.  A vellum portrait, a canvas portrait, a suede portrait, a wooden framed oil painting, some unfinished portraits, and a carefully painted silk screen are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southwest* northwest*.
[Elindale's Temple.]

While the tree appears gigantic from the outside, it still is nothing compared to the impression of being on the inside. Hollow branches large enough to pass a drake branch out here, the surfaces smooth, but in a most curious way. It is apparent that no tools were used to create these passageways, yet there is no evidence to give one the impression that the passageways formed over a long period of time. The branches have grown in this manner intentionally, quite unlike any plantlife found anywhere on the land.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: north* northeast* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.
nw
>[Elindale's Temple, Altar Room.]

The hum of busy bees and hummingbirds add a tone of unity to the soft chants of the priests and murmurings of those here to offer up the sacrifices and tithes to the great Goddess, Elindale. Several monks wearing floor length robes sit in silence, with the occasional clasped hands rising up in a particularly vibrant part of prayer. The altar itself is composed of growing flowers, the tiny buds enclosing gems and gold alike. Around the base of the altar grows a ring of mushrooms, vibrantly cloaked in red with white spots dotting the umbrellas.  A blooming altar of flowers and a red and white ring of mushrooms are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southeast*.

info rel
>
You are a Charitable follower of Elindale.

You have earned 4038 favors.

You are Balanced within your Orderly alignment.

help donate
>
Command name: donate

Description
-----------
DONATE allows you to donate items or money to your deity.
NOTE: You must be at your temple in order to donate.

Syntax
------
DONATE [#] <item|gold|silver> TO <deity>

Examples
--------
DONATE 500 gold to Odarous
DONATE broadsword to Elindale

donate 200 gold to elindale
>You cannot do that while you are flying!
land softly
>You fly down and land.
kneel at al
>You kneel at the blooming altar of flowers.
donate 200 gold to elindale
>You kneel and make your offering to Elindale!
Your gold purse suddenly feels lighter!

You feel your deity smiling down upon you.

info rel
>
You are a Charitable follower of Elindale.

You have earned 8038 favors.

You are Balanced within your Orderly alignment.

donate 180 gold to elindale
>You kneel and make your offering to Elindale!
Your gold purse suddenly feels lighter!

You feel your deity smiling down upon you.

A voice speaks in your mind, "My child, you have done well.  Your great devotion to me has earned you a raise in standing within my temple.  As a new initiate within this standing, you must prove yourself worthy, and seek to even more diligently show me your devotion.  Your favor with me shall be adjusted to represent your renewal on this path."

>[Treehaven Bank]

The smell of freshly cut lumber fills the large lobby of the newly finished bank.  The roof is a collage of intertwined branches and their leaves from above, with a delicately crafted wooden lattice frame set with glass panels just beneath.  The trunk of the Mother tree serves as the back wall of the bank, with the tellers sitting at booths just in front of it.  Some finely crafted wooden stairs are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
bank bal
>
You approach a teller and quietly request an account balance...

The teller says, "I'm sorry, but I don't see you in our record books.  Perhaps you're thinking of another bank?"
bank req box
>
You approach a teller and quietly request your safety deposit box...

The teller hands you a closed steel box.
The teller says, "Please don't leave the bank with it.  Return it to me when you're done."
open box
>You open the closed steel box.
l in box
>Inside the open steel box you see a long handled rosewood guitar, a rainbow ribboned paper pixie mask, an orange striped paper cat mask, a folded blooming paper flower invitation, an open clear glass jar, an ivory parchment wedding invitations, a majestic hand-carved gold dragon statuette, a swirling multicolored globe, a battle scarred ebony parrying shield, a tiny golden bird cage, a skull shaped candle, a heavily tarnished wall sconce, a sack of sugar, a closed turquoise leather portfolio, an embroidered lupine hide cloak, a small leather waterskin, and an onyx hoop earring.
bank return box
>
You approach a teller and quietly request to return your safety deposit box...

The teller accepts the open steel box and places it back in the vault.
bank dep 10 gold
>
You approach a teller, place your coins on the counter, and quietly request to make a deposit...

The teller says, "Since you don't currently have an account with us, I'll go ahead and open a new account for you."
The teller says, "Your new account balance is 1000 silver."

>[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent, a closed iron gate, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: south* west*.

>With a click, you unlock the closed iron gate.
You open the closed iron gate.
[South Gate.]

A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. Guards carefully eye all that enter or exit the city, beckoning gruffly to random travelers for a closer inspection. The structure of the guards' barracks is visible above the road to the west. A weathered wooden sign is posted by the gate.  An open iron gate, a wooden sign, a street lantern, an open thick stone door, and a fluffy white layer of snow are here.

This room is illuminated.

Obvious exits: north*.
